definition: daring/presumptuous/daredevil
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
absurd/fantastic/presumptuous/rash
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: It is audacious, disruptive and preposterous on the face of it.
sentences.chinese: 表面看来，其胆大妄为，且颠覆常理，又荒诞可笑。

sentences.english: I hope you will forgive me for my nerves .
sentences.chinese: 我希望你能原谅我的胆大妄为。

sentences.english: Here, Madoff made his most audacious innovation.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，麦道夫创造了他最胆大妄为的发明。

sentences.english: He said this nuclear capability could embolden the government in Tehran.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这种核能力会使伊朗政府更加胆大妄为。

sentences.english: And who in China would have the temerity to arrange such an encounter?
sentences.chinese: 中国又有谁能够如此胆大妄为地安排这种会见呢？

sentences.english: Day and night online, chat bubble sister, philandering, reckless.
sentences.chinese: 昼夜上网，聊天泡妹，打情骂俏，胆大妄为。

sentences.english: Why does David do these dare-devil deeds?
sentences.chinese: 大卫为什么会做出这些胆大妄为的事情呢？

sentences.english: And this threat of punishment keeps you on the straight and narrow.
sentences.chinese: 惩罚的威胁让你一直遵纪守法，不敢胆大妄为。

sentences.english: Party leaders resented the newspapers’ boldness.
sentences.chinese: 领导不满报纸的胆大妄为。

definition: reckless/extremely daring
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
outrageously bold in one's lust/debauched (idiom)
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: egotistical/arrogant/brassy
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
domineering/bossy
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
savage/furious
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to behave unscrupulously
to take rash action
